diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@for file in $(git ls-files '*.astub'); do
  output=$(comm -23   `: print the lines present in the first output but missing from the second` \
    <(grep -Po '(?<=@)[a-zA-Z0-9.]*' "$file" | sort -u   `: all annotations used across the file`) \
    <(grep -Po '(?<=import ).*(?=;)' "$file" | rev | cut -d. -f1 | rev | sort -u    `: all symbols imported in the file`))

comments.body: ``` `: ....` ``` is a tricky way to introduce comments in shell that won't reach the end of line (and thus won't include the trailing `\`)

diffHunk:

for file in $(git ls-files '*.astub'); do
  output=$(comm -23   `: print the lines present in the first output but missing from the second` \
    <(grep -Po '(?<=@)[a-zA-Z0-9.]*' "$file" | sort -u   `: all annotations used across the file`) \
    <(grep -Po '(?<=import ).*(?=;)' "$file" | rev | cut -d. -f1 | rev | sort -u    `: all symbols imported in the file`))
